issue.title: [C++]  compiling issue on Windows
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-4821](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4821). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
I'm using arrow/cpp into my cpp project and got this compiling issue. I'm not sure where this issue comes from. I don't have it on MacOS. Can anyone help to point out the problem?
```java

E:\Source\emotivpro\EmotivPro\thirdParty\Parquet\src\ThirdParty\arrow\cpp\src\arrow/util/hash.h(32): warning C4003: not enough actual parameters for macro 'max'

E:\Source\emotivpro\EmotivPro\thirdParty\Parquet\src\ThirdParty\arrow\cpp\src\arrow/util/hash.h(32): error C2589: '(': illegal token on right side of '::'

E:\Source\emotivpro\EmotivPro\thirdParty\Parquet\src\ThirdParty\arrow\cpp\src\arrow/util/hash.h(32): error C2062: type 'unknown-type' unexpected
```

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4821?focusedCommentId=16789637) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I think you may be hitting issues addressed in https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/53e359b850afda0a39f0469cb5f54a3e6a4701fb/cpp/src/arrow/util/windows_compatibility.h

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4821?focusedCommentId=16873336) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
`[~thamha]` Do you still get this issue or can we close?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4821?focusedCommentId=16876691) by Tham (thamha):*
`[~pitrou]` we don't get this issue anymore. We fixed it by using forward declaration and let arrow header files be private in .cc file.
